[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Clarus system defines high-level requirements for a road weather data management system, ensuring quality-controlled data collection, processing, and dissemination to enhance road safety.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Clarus enables real-time weather data ingestion, quality control, and dissemination to support decision-making by transportation agencies and emergency responders.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Clarus integrates with weather sensors and transportation systems for structured data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Clarus provides interactive web and mobile dashboards with advanced visualization, customizable reports, and real-time analytics to enhance usability and decision-making.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Clarus supports integration with standard weather sensors and monitoring equipment.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Clarus operates with APIs for data retrieval and third-party tool compatibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Clarus ensures secure data transmission using HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Clarus optimizes memory usage for efficient processing and storage of weather data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Clarus enables real-time data acquisition, processing, and analysis.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Clarus is configurable for deployment in various environmental conditions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Clarus integrates with cloud-based analytics and reporting platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Clarus relies on compatible sensors, secure communication networks, and standardized APIs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Clarus enables real-time data collection, anomaly detection, and quality control for road weather monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Clarus is designed for DOT personnel, weather analysts, and emergency responders with diverse technical backgrounds.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Clarus assumes operational weather sensors, stable communication infrastructure, and API standardization.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Clarus: System designed for road weather observation and decision support.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: HTTPS: Hyper Text Transfer Protocol Secure

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall ingest weather data via standardized APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide real-time weather updates through dashboards and notifications.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall perform automated quality control on incoming data (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate alerts for detected data anomalies (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support spatial queries for localized weather data retrieval.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive and accessible dashboard featuring adaptive UI elements, customizable layouts, and user-friendly navigation for users with varying levels of technical expertise.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process incoming weather data within 5 seconds while ensuring optimized computational efficiency and minimal latency, even under peak load conditions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store processed data for at least 7 days (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to open-source weather data standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with applicable data security and privacy regulations.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional, performance, and integration testing shall validate API interactions, data quality control, system performance under high data loads, and ensure compliance with data integrity, fault tolerance, and failover mechanisms.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and test datasets.
[SEC] 5. References: Clarus Concept of Operations, DOT Weather Standards, NIST Guidelines.
